verses.text: Now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah , \add that\add* Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the defenced cities of Judah , and took them.
And the king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem unto king Hezekiah with a great army. And he stood by the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller’s field.
Then came forth unto him Eliakim , Hilkiah’s son , which was over the house , and Shebna the scribe , and Joah , Asaph’s son , the recorder.\f + \fr 36.3 \ft scribe: or, secretary\f* \p
¶ And Rabshakeh said unto them, Say ye now to Hezekiah , Thus saith the great king , the king of Assyria , What confidence \add is\add* this wherein thou trustest ?

I say , \add sayest thou\add*, (but \add they are but\add* vain words ) \add I have\add* counsel and strength for war : now on whom dost thou trust , that thou rebellest against me?\f + \fr 36.5 \ft vain…: Heb. a word of lips\f*\f + \fr 36.5 \ft I have…: or, but counsel and strength are for the war\f*
Lo, thou trustest in the staff of this broken reed , on Egypt ; whereon if a man lean , it will go into his hand , and pierce it: so \add is\add* Pharaoh king of Egypt to all that trust in him.

But if thou say to me, We trust in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God : \add is it\add* not he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away , and said to Judah and to Jerusalem , Ye shall worship before this altar ?

Now therefore give pledges , I pray thee, to my master the king of Assyria , and I will give thee two thousand horses , if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.\f + \fr 36.8 \ft pledges: or, hostages\f*
How then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master’s servants , and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen ?

And am I now come up without the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* against this land to destroy it? the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto me, Go up against this land , and destroy it. \p

¶ Then said Eliakim and Shebna and Joah unto Rabshakeh , Speak , I pray thee, unto thy servants in the Syrian language ; for we understand \add it:\add* and speak not to us in the Jews’ language , in the ears of the people that \add are\add* on the wall. \p

¶ But Rabshakeh said , Hath my master sent me to thy master and to thee to speak these words ? \add hath he\add* not \add sent me\add* to the men that sit upon the wall , that they may eat their own dung , and drink their own piss with you?
Then Rabshakeh stood , and cried with a loud voice in the Jews’ language , and said , Hear ye the words of the great king , the king of Assyria.
Thus saith the king , Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you.

Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, saying , The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* will surely deliver us: this city shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.

Hearken not to Hezekiah : for thus saith the king of Assyria , Make \add an agreement\add* with me \add by\add* a present , and come out to me: and eat ye every one of his vine , and every one of his fig tree , and drink ye every one the waters of his own cistern ;\f + \fr 36.16 \ft Make…: or, Seek my favour by a present: Heb. Make with me a blessing\f*
Until I come and take you away to a land like your own land , a land of corn and wine , a land of bread and vineyards.

\add Beware\add* lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will deliver us. Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria ?
Where \add are\add* the gods of Hamath and Arphad ? where \add are\add* the gods of Sepharvaim ? and have they delivered Samaria out of my hand ?
Who \add are they\add* among all the gods of these lands , that have delivered their land out of my hand , that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand ?
But they held their peace , and answered him not a word : for the king’s commandment was, saying , Answer him not. \p

¶ Then came Eliakim , the son of Hilkiah , that \add was\add* over the household , and Shebna the scribe , and Joah , the son of Asaph , the recorder , to Hezekiah with \add their\add* clothes rent , and told him the words of Rabshakeh.
